inputs.prompt:
GOAL: create an anchor face reference for a children’s storybook. The output must be a single illustrated portrait of the child, with maximum likeness to the reference photo.
IDENTITY — ABSOLUTE PRIORITY: the child must look exactly like the reference child, instantly recognizable. Keep the same facial geometry: head shape, forehead, eyebrows, eye shape and spacing, nose shape, lips, cheeks, chin, ears, skin tone, hairstyle, and age appearance. Do not change facial features.
RENDERING: realistic portrait with a bit cartoon tint, crisp sharp facial features, clear eyes with catchlights, subtle natural skin shading, clean edges, no blur, no smudge.
STYLE: premium children’s book illustration, realistic, gentle warm light, clean linework only if needed (minimal).
COMPOSITION: close-up portrait (head and shoulders), centered, neutral background (soft gradient), front or slight 3/4 view, friendly natural smile, no accessories that hide face, no text.
AVOID: chibi, kawaii, anime face, oversized eyes, generic baby face, simplified facial features, wrong identity, different hairstyle, different skin tone, heavy stylization, blur, distortion, text, watermark, logo, frame, border, collage, pasted/cutout look.

FACE ID LOCK (ABSOLUTE PRIORITY):
Use the child face from the provided input portrait (reference face image) EXACTLY. The child must be instantly recognizable.
Do NOT change identity or “improve” the face. Keep the same facial geometry and proportions: head shape, eyebrows, eye shape/spacing, nose, lips, cheeks, chin, ears, skin tone, hairstyle, age appearance. No generic face, no different child.

EXPRESSION (CONTEXT-DRIVEN, IDENTITY UNCHANGED):
Match the facial expression to the scene context and mood in each image. Change ONLY the expression (muscles), not the identity: do not alter facial features, proportions, skin tone, hairstyle, or age. Avoid exaggerated cartoon/anime expressions.

RENDER RULE:
Face = detailed painted portrait (sharp eyes, clean edges), fully illustrated (no cutout/collage).
Body/clothes/hands/background = friendly children’s cartoon painting but with clear painting

OUTFIT LOCK (same in all images):
light blue hoodie, dark navy jeans, white sneakers.

CAMERA:
Vary head angle slightly between images, but keep gaze looking directly at the viewer (eye contact).

AVOID:
wrong identity, different child, face changes, beautified face, generic baby face, anime/chibi, oversized eyes, blur, distortion, deformed hands, extra fingers, watermark, logo, signature, frame, border, collage, cutout, pasted face.
